TopicTitle: How do I un/rebind my arrow keys

Articles.Content: I like to use my arrow keys as a part of my flight controls, but for some reason there is no option to unbind the arrow keys from the camera.  Is there a way to unbind the arrow keys so they don't effect the camera when flying? and if so, how?
Yep, wondering the same thing for the same reason.

Same issue here. I've been to all JSON files , all menus, never found anything. Arrow key are very natural for lefty people, I just  cant play without them  :'(

Edited January 20 by Kwriss

Permanently binding the arrow keys to anything is pretty Lame.

Notice the capital "L".  I am also left handed though well adapted right handed gaming.

However, it i think limiting / restricting key binding of such an important button is crazy. 

It seems to be the most commonly user defined button for movement outside of WASD.

When Rover, Reaction, & Tranlation are all mapped independent you can have supreme rover control. 

 

BTW how do you set SAS to active & Mono Prop systems to only gas when you hit a key? Manual didn't seem to work but Jeb was in the Hot Seat and may have been spamming the wrong buttons altogether.

Edited January 24 by Fizzlebop Smith

Talked to some engineers about this today. It looks like the arrow keys CAN be rebound, but the camera controls are hardcoded in - so the keys end up doing two actions.

This is mostly connected to the camera system which is due for a refactor - I'll post here when I have an update.
